bridge-type.label: Spotify Player Bridge
bridge-type.description: Bridge representing the Spotify Player in the context of a user account. The bridge is associated with one specific Spotify account. If you want to control your devices in the context of different accounts you have to register a bridge for each account.

parameter.name: clientId
parameter.label: Application Client ID
parameter.description: This is the Client ID provided by Spotify when you add a new Application for openHAB to your Spotify Account. Go to https://developer.spotify.com/

parameter.name: clientSecret
parameter.label: Application Client Secret
parameter.description: This is the Client Secret provided by Spotify when you add a new Application for openHAB to your Spotify Account.

parameter.name: refreshPeriod
parameter.label: Connect refresh period (seconds)
parameter.description: This is the frequency of the polling requests to the Spotify Connect WebAPI. There are limits to the number of requests that can be sent to the WebAPI. The more often you poll, the better status updates - at the risk of running out of your request quota.

parameter.name: refreshToken
parameter.label: Client Authorization Refresh Token
parameter.description: This is the refresh token provided by Spotify when you authorize yourself with the Web API and grant the required scope access. After authorization this field will hold the refreshToken used to re-authorize with the Web API.

thing-type.label: Spotify Connect Device Thing
thing-type.description: Thing representing a Spotify Connect device. The device exists in the context of the bridge and the Spotfy account associated with the bride. This means the same device can be present as a thing under each Spotify bridge you have configured.

channel-type.label: Access Token
channel-type.description: This channel provides the access token used to authorize calls to the Spotify WebAPI. It can be used from rules or client-side scripting make call to WebAPI.
